verses.verse: Then Job<WH347> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559>,
Of a truth<WH551> I know<WH3045> that it is so<WH582>: But how can man be just<WH6663> with God<WH410>?
If he be<WH2654> pleased to contend<WH7378> with him<WH6030>, He cannot answer him one<WH259> of a thousand<WH505>.
He is wise<WH2450> in heart<WH3824>, and mighty<WH533> in strength<WH3581>: Who hath hardened<WH7185> himself against him<WH7999>, and prospered? --
Him that removeth<WH6275> the mountains<WH2022>, and they know<WH3045> it not<WH2015>, When he overturneth them in his anger<WH639>;
That shaketh<WH7264> the earth<WH776> out of its place<WH4725>, And the pillars<WH5982> thereof tremble<WH6426>;
That commandeth<WH559> the sun<WH2775>, and it riseth<WH2224> not<WH2856>, And sealeth up the stars<WH3556>;
That alone stretcheth out<WH5186> the heavens<WH8064>, And treadeth<WH1869> upon the waves<WH1116> of the sea<WH3220>;
That maketh<WH6213> the Bear<WH5906>, Orion<WH3685>, and the Pleiades<WH3598>, And the chambers<WH2315> of the south<WH8486>;
That doeth<WH6213> great things<WH1419> past<WH369> finding out<WH2714>, Yea<WH6381>, marvellous things without number<WH4557>.
Lo <WH5674>, he goeth by me<WH7200>, and I see him not<WH2498>: He passeth on also<WH995>, but I perceive him not.
Behold <WH2862>, he seizeth the prey<WH7725>, who can hinder him<WH559>? Who will say unto him<WH6213>, What doest thou?
God <WH433> will not withdraw<WH7725> his anger<WH639>; The helpers<WH5826> of Rahab<WH7293> do stoop under him<WH7817>.
How much less shall I answer<WH6030> him<WH977>, And choose out my words to reason with him<WH1697>?
Whom <WH6663>, though I were righteous, yet would I not answer<WH6030>; I would make supplication<WH2603> to my judge<WH8199>.
If I had called<WH7121>, and he had answered<WH6030> me<WH539>, Yet would I not believe that he hearkened<WH238> unto my voice<WH6963>.
For he breaketh<WH7779> me with a tempest<WH8183>, And multiplieth<WH7235> my wounds<WH6482> without cause<WH2600>.
He will not suffer<WH5414> me to take<WH7725> my breath<WH7307>, But filleth<WH7646> me with bitterness<WH4472>.
If we speak of strength<WH3581>, lo<WH533>, he is mighty! And if of justice<WH4941>, Who<WH3259>, saith he, will summon me?
Though I be righteous<WH6663>, mine own mouth<WH6310> shall condemn<WH7561> me<WH8535>: Though I be perfect, it shall prove me perverse<WH6140>.
I am perfect<WH8535>; I regard<WH3045> not myself<WH5315>; I despise<WH3988> my life<WH5315>.
It is all one<WH259>; therefore I say<WH559>, He destroyeth<WH3615> the perfect<WH8535> and the wicked<WH7563>.
If the scourge<WH7752> slay<WH4191> suddenly<WH6597>, He will mock<WH3932> at the trial<WH4531> of the innocent<WH5355>.
The earth<WH776> is given<WH5414> into the hand<WH3027> of the wicked<WH7563>; He covereth<WH3680> the faces<WH6440> of the judges<WH8199> thereof<WH645>: If it be not he, who then is it?
Now my days<WH3117> are swifter<WH7043> than a post<WH7323>: They flee away<WH1272>, they see<WH7200> no good<WH2896>,
They are passed away<WH2498> as<WH5973> the swift<WH16> ships<WH591>; As the eagle<WH5404> that swoopeth<WH2907> on the prey<WH400>.
If I say<WH559>, I will forget<WH7911> my complaint<WH7879>, I will put off<WH5800> my sad countenance<WH6440>, and be of good cheer<WH1082>;
I am afraid<WH3025> of all my sorrows<WH6094>, I know<WH3045> that thou wilt not hold me innocent<WH5352>.
I shall be condemned<WH7561>; Why then do I labor<WH3021> in vain<WH1892>?
If I wash<WH7364> myself with<WH7950> snow water<WH4325>, And make my hands<WH3709> never<WH1252> so clean<WH2141>;
Yet <WH227> wilt thou plunge<WH2881> me in the ditch<WH7845>, And mine own clothes<WH8008> shall abhor me<WH8581>.
For he is not a man<WH376>, as I am<WH6030>, that I should answer him<WH935>, That we should come together<WH3162> in judgment<WH4941>.
There is<WH3426> no umpire<WH3198> betwixt us<WH7896>, That might lay his hand<WH3027> upon us both<WH8147>.
Let him take<WH5493> his rod<WH7626> away<WH5493> from me<WH367>, And let not his terror make me afraid<WH367>:
Then would I speak<WH1696>, and not fear him<WH3372>; For I am not so in myself.
